original_definition: 'glandless circulator' means a circulator with the shaft of the motor directly coupled to the impeller and the motor immersed in the pumped medium;
generated_definition: 'glandless circulator' means a fan or blower without a grille or louvers, used to circulate air or gas in a system.

Article 1: 1.   This Regulation establishes ecodesign requirements for the placing on the market of glandlessstandalone circulators andglandless circulators integrated inproducts.
1.   This Regulation establishes ecodesign requirements for the placing on the market of glandless standalone circulators and glandless circulators integrated in products.
Article 2: ‘glandless circulator’ means a circulator with the shaft of the motor directly coupled to the impeller and the motor immersed in the pumped medium;
Article 8: From 1 August 2015, glandless standalone circulators and glandless circulators integrated in products shall have an energy efficiency index (EEI) of not more than 0,23, calculated in accordance with Annex II, point 2.
from 1 August 2015, glandless standalone circulators and glandless circulators integrated in products shall meet the efficiency level defined in Annex I, point 1(2).

From 1 August 2015, glandlessstandalone circulators andglandless circulators integrated inproducts shall have an energy efficiency index (EEI) of not more than 0,23, calculated in accordance with Annex II, point 2.
from 1 August 2015, glandlessstandalone circulators andglandless circulators integrated inproducts shall meet the efficiency level defined in Annex I, point 1(2).
Not Article: implementing Directive 2005/32/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council with regard to ecodesign requirements for glandlessstandalone circulators andglandless circulators integrated inproducts
